meanings.definition: extending back beyond memory, record, or knowledge
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins were immemorially old, with no one left to remember their origin.
meanings.sent2: The village had an immemorially old tradition of celebrating the harvest festival.
meanings.sent3: The immemorially ancient tree in the backyard was rumored to have witnessed the founding of the town.
meanings.sent4: The immemorially towering mountains seemed to touch the sky with their majestic presence.
meanings.sent5: The immemorially old castle stood as a silent witness to centuries of history.

meanings.sent1: The story had been told immemorially, passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of storytelling had been practiced immemorially in the village.
meanings.sent3: The cat slept immemorially on the windowsill, oblivious to the passing time.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed immemorially, carrying tales of the land it traversed.
meanings.sent5: The stars shone immemorially in the night sky, unchanged by the passage of time.
